The decision was made over the holidays 2010. For the last 10 years, we have all been equally involved in making decisions. This triumvirate approach has real benefits in terms of shared wisdom, and we will continue to discuss the big decisions among the three of us. But we have also agreed to clarify our individual roles so there's clear responsibility and accountability at the top of the company. Google co-founder Larry Page will lead product development and technology strategy, and starting from 4 April 2010 he will take charge of day-to-day operations as Google's Chief Executive Officer.
